noun.description: The fastest pace of a horse or other quadruped, with all the feet off the ground together in each stride.
examples: the horse broke into a furious gallop

verb.description: (of a horse) go at the pace of a gallop.
(of a process or time) progress rapidly in a seemingly uncontrollable manner.
examples: panic about the deadline galloping toward them

origin: Early 16th century: from Old French galop (noun), galoper, variants of Old Northern French walop, waloper (see wallop).
